alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 11 at 10:55AM EDT until September 11 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... South central Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southwestern Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 1145 AM EDT/1045 AM CDT/. * At 1054 AM EDT/954 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stonemill Creek, or 20 miles southwest of Blountstown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Stonemill Creek, Wewahitchka, Honeyville, Lewis, Chipola Cutoff, Chipola Park and Red Hill. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
